Column Comment.0: CALCULATED RESERVE CLASS ID: unique identifier for the reserve class to becalculated.
Column Comment.1: CALCULATION SEQUENCE NUMBER: this column indicates the order in whichcalculations are to be performed in order to determine the reserves for this class.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.4: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.5: FORMULA: the equation that is to be calculated to determine the value of thisreserve class.
Column Comment.6: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.7: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.8: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.9: USE RULE: a rule that controls when this formula is to be used for calculation ofreserve classes.
Column Comment.10: FORMULA USE ORDER SEQUENCE NUMBER: The order that the formulas shouldbe tested to determine whether it can be used in calculation. Use the first formula thattests useable.
Column Comment.11: RESERVE ENTITY USE TYPE: Differentiates between reserve classes where theclient expects to enter data, i.e. Proved Developed Producing, from those reserveclasses which are defined for reporting purposes only, i.e. Proved plus 1/2 Probable.
Column Comment.12: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.14: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.16: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
